page.title: 19News Items from Local Press
page.content: From East Kilbride News (28/6/85) { {JEYES VOLUNTARY REDUNDANCY PLAN}The College Milton factory will have to lay off 73 of its 176 workforce due to competition and recession. {ARMED ROBBERY}A large sum of money was stolen in a hold-up at the Queensway Service Station {SNACK BAR MUST GO}The District Council has ordered Dick's Diner, a late night snack bar, to quit the Town Centre car park because of increase in vandalism. {ASBESTOS WORK AT BATHS}Â£200,000 needed to remove asbestos from Dollan Baths which will be closed for about 6 mths {POSTER COMPETITION }Louise Petrie of East Milton Primary won second prize in a Calderglen Country Park Poster Competition {HOUSE FOR SALE}Three apartment mid- terrace villa for sale at Â£24,000
